xwikidoc.content:
Any change made to a document is saved under Version Control. You can see the version of a document by looking at "**History**" tab the bottom of the document.
A document version is identifier by two numbers, separated by a dot: <Major>.<Minor> (e.g. 3.2). The XWiki versioning system allows the distinction between major and minor edits. When editing a page, the user has the option to decide whether his edit brings major or minor changes to the document. Saving a major version will increase the first component and reset the second to "1", while a minor version will just increase the second component.
By default, minor edits do not appear in the document history. The option "Show minor edits" will list all the versions, including minor ones.
